intro: Hololepis pedunculata, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its strap-shaped leaves and clustered inflorescences. The plant is typically found in coastal and lowland areas, growing in sandy or loamy soils. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, often arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Hololepis pedunculata is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used traditionally by Māori for various purposes.
